pr_title: Updated direct connection config APIs and docs

timeline.message: Updated direct connection config APIs and docs

timeline.bodyText: what does 0 as idle connection timeout mean?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: I have referred this in docs in get/set API.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText:
this.connectionTimeout = null;	
why is this null?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: will get rid of the redundant initializer.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: if the user switches to DirectHttps some of these will not be relevant.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
Yups, DirectHttps is anyway not supported programatically. We also don't want to encourage it, but I get your point.
May be we should call this config as DirectTcpConnectionConfig ?
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText:
Direct from CX will always be TCP.
Https might be hacky workaround which is best avoided (Service team doesn't recommended it).
Refering HTTPS in code docs if-any will lead a ambiguity/confuson.
If Https is configured and some are not applicable, one options to fail at runtime which is okey.
replies.author: kirankumarkolli

timeline.bodyText:
Is 'direct client' mean Direct TCP connection?
Client & connection overload confusing.
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText:
direct client means direct tcp client itself, and not connections.
direct client creates connections, and this timeout defines how much time before we drop connection establishment.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText:
Is it to keep the connections warm?
How are broken connections identified? How will it impact the latencies/performance?
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText:
Yes, to keep connections warm. When the connections are closed, rntbd logs it.
We have seen a connection establishment takes anywhere between 200ms - 300ms .
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: Guidance on when to tune to what values will help CX.
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText: Guidance on these can vary based on customer, case to case. Referring material in perf guide will help and as you mentioned we can refer the perf guide in this docs.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

timeline.bodyText: Include references to the Java perf best practices.
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

timeline.bodyText:
Am not fully clear on endpointIdletimeout vs connecitonideltimeout.
Lets please cover at depth the details.
How about a conceptual MD file in Github which can be referenced?
We can extend it with patterns and guidance (some parts might eventually get promoted to docs).
Also please refer the performance guide references across code docs extensively.
/cc: @David-Noble-at-work , @moderakh
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -98,49 +116,57 @@ public DirectConnectionConfig setIdleEndpointTimeout(Duration idleEndpointTimeou
     }
 
     /**
-     * Gets the max channels per endpoint
-     * @return the max channels per endpoint
+     * Gets the max connections per endpoint
+     * Default value is 30

replies.bodyText:
endpoint is a pool of connections per replica. I will improve the documentation around this.
We initially had a MD file explaining Rntbd architecture. I will work with @David-Noble-at-work  to introduce it back if we can.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: How about stating how these manifest for netty underlying for advanced users?
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText: Sure, will attach respective Netty links here.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: connection vs socket vs others: Is there guidance or patterns from azure SDK's?
timeline.author: kirankumarkolli

replies.bodyText:
So far we have seen connection - as that is the easiest concept for an end user.
Http client from azure-core -> 
  
    
      azure-sdk-for-java/sdk/core/azure-core-http-jdk-httpclient/src/main/java/com/azure/core/http/jdk/httpclient/JdkAsyncHttpClientBuilder.java
    
    
         Line 73
      in
      fc26120
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public JdkAsyncHttpClientBuilder connectionTimeout(Duration connectionTimeout) { 
        
    
  


It uses connectionTimeout as well.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.message: Updated docs with performance tips guide

timeline.author: David-Noble-at-work

timeline.bodyText: It is the idleConnectionTimeout that defaults to zero. The connectTimeout defaults to the value of requestTimeout: 60 seconds prior to this PR.
timeline.author: David-Noble-at-work

replies.bodyText: Cool, will add default value here - and will add the constant too..
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.message: Updated default connection timeout value and other documentation
